question.text: Some people think that modern communication technology is having a negative effect on social relationships. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this?

questionType.explanation: You must clearly state whether you agree, disagree, or partially agree that modern communication technology has a negative effect on social relationships.

structure.introduction: While concerns exist about digital communication, I disagree that [modern communication technology is primarily negative] because [brief reason about maintaining connections].
structure.body1: Communication technology's primary benefit is [enabling long-distance relationships]. This is because [explanation]. For instance, [specific example about video calls/messaging]. As a result, [positive consequence].
structure.body2: Although critics argue that [digital communication reduces face-to-face interaction], this overlooks [positive aspects]. For example, [evidence of benefits]. Therefore, [conclusion supporting technology].

example.introduction: While concerns exist about digital communication, I disagree that modern communication technology is primarily negative because it has fundamentally enhanced our ability to maintain meaningful relationships across distances.
example.body1: Communication technology's primary benefit is enabling people to sustain relationships that would otherwise fade due to geographical separation. Video calling and instant messaging allow families separated by work or education to share daily moments and maintain emotional closeness. For instance, parents working abroad can watch their children grow up through daily video calls, while elderly relatives can stay connected with family despite mobility limitations. As a result, technology has prevented the isolation that distance once inevitably created.
example.body2: Although critics argue that digital communication reduces face-to-face interaction, this overlooks how technology complements rather than replaces in-person contact. During the COVID-19 pandemic, communication platforms sustained relationships during mandatory physical separation, demonstrating their value as essential rather than detrimental tools. For example, families maintained regular contact through video calls, couples strengthened bonds despite lockdowns, and friends organized virtual gatherings. Therefore, technology serves as a crucial supplement to, not a substitute for, traditional interaction.
example.conclusion: In conclusion, while excessive or mindless technology use can pose challenges, communication technology has predominantly enhanced social relationships by bridging distances and providing flexibility in how we maintain connections in an increasingly mobile and globalized world.

steps.title: Build Paragraphs
steps.completionCriteria: Complete all 4 paragraphs (10+ words per blank)

content.instructions: Fill in each blank to build your essay paragraph by paragraph. Aim for 10-15 words per blank. Click 'Show Hint' if you need help.

paragraphs.name: Introduction
paragraphs.template: While _____ [acknowledge the topic or opposite view], I _____ [state your position clearly] that modern communication technology is having a negative effect on social relationships because _____ [give brief reason].

blanks.label: Acknowledge the topic or opposite view
blanks.hint: Acknowledge that technology exists or mention the opposing viewpoint briefly
blanks.placeholder: e.g., communication technology has enabled unprecedented connectivity across distances

blanks.label: Brief reason for your position
blanks.hint: One clear reason WHY you hold this view about technology and relationships
blanks.placeholder: e.g., it has enhanced rather than diminished our ability to maintain meaningful connections across distances

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 1
paragraphs.template: _____ [Topic sentence about your main point]. This is because _____ [explain the main reason]. For instance, _____ [give a specific example with details]. As a result, _____ [state the consequence or broader impact].

blanks.label: Topic sentence about your main point
blanks.hint: If disagreeing: state main benefit. If agreeing: state main problem. Use 'One major advantage/concern is...'
blanks.placeholder: e.g., Communication technology's greatest strength lies in its ability to maintain relationships across geographical distances

blanks.label: Explain the main reason
blanks.hint: WHY does this happen? Explain the mechanism or reasoning behind your point.
blanks.placeholder: e.g., video calls and instant messaging enable families and friends to share experiences and emotions despite physical separation

blanks.label: Specific example with details
blanks.hint: Give a concrete example - families abroad, long-distance relationships, elderly people, OR phone addiction at dinner
blanks.placeholder: e.g., parents working overseas can participate in their children's daily lives through video calls, maintaining emotional bonds

blanks.label: Consequence or broader impact
blanks.hint: What is the ultimate result or significance of this point?
blanks.placeholder: e.g., this technology has prevented the isolation and relationship deterioration that distance once inevitably caused

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 2
paragraphs.template: _____ [Topic sentence - second main point or counter-argument]. _____ [Explain your reasoning]. For example, _____ [specific example]. _____ [Conclude this point].

blanks.label: Topic sentence
blanks.hint: If disagreeing: add another benefit OR address critics. If agreeing: add another problem. Use 'Furthermore' or 'However'
blanks.placeholder: e.g., However, critics argue that digital communication reduces the quality of face-to-face interactions

blanks.label: Explain reasoning
blanks.hint: Develop your point with explanation showing why this matters
blanks.placeholder: e.g., While this concern has merit, it overlooks how technology complements rather than replaces in-person contact

blanks.label: Specific example
blanks.hint: Concrete example supporting your second point - COVID-19, social media comparison, family dinners, or online communities
blanks.placeholder: e.g., during the COVID-19 pandemic, video conferencing sustained relationships during mandatory physical separation, proving its essential value

blanks.label: Conclude this point
blanks.hint: Final thought - reinforce your position or acknowledge complexity while maintaining your stance
blanks.placeholder: e.g., Therefore, technology serves as a valuable supplement to traditional interaction rather than a harmful replacement

paragraphs.name: Conclusion
paragraphs.template: In conclusion, while _____ [acknowledge other perspective or complexity], I _____ [restate your position] because _____ [give final reasoning or insight].

blanks.label: Acknowledge other perspective or complexity
blanks.hint: Briefly mention the opposite view or acknowledge that there are multiple factors
blanks.placeholder: e.g., excessive or mindless use of communication technology can pose challenges to interpersonal connection

blanks.label: Restate your position
blanks.hint: Clearly restate whether you agree/disagree/partially agree about negative effects
blanks.placeholder: e.g., believe its impact has been predominantly positive for social relationships

blanks.label: Final reasoning or insight
blanks.hint: End with a strong final thought about WHY or what this means for society/future
blanks.placeholder: e.g., it has enabled meaningful connections to thrive across distances in our increasingly mobile and globalized world

content.instructions: Now combine your paragraphs into a complete essay. You can copy from Step 5 and edit, or write fresh. Aim for 250-280 words total.

modelEssay.text:
While modern communication technology has enabled unprecedented global connectivity, I disagree that it is having a primarily negative effect on social relationships because it has fundamentally enhanced our ability to maintain meaningful connections across distances and circumstances.

The greatest strength of communication technology lies in its capacity to sustain relationships that would otherwise deteriorate due to geographical separation. Video calling platforms and instant messaging applications allow families and friends to share daily experiences, provide emotional support, and participate in important life moments despite physical distance. For instance, parents working overseas can maintain close bonds with their children through daily video calls, sharing meals virtually and helping with homework in real-time. Similarly, elderly individuals with mobility limitations can reduce isolation by staying connected with relatives through user-friendly video chat applications. As a result, technology has eliminated the relationship-eroding effects of distance that previous generations simply had to accept.

Although critics argue that digital communication reduces face-to-face interaction quality and encourages superficial connections, this perspective overlooks how technology complements rather than replaces traditional communication. The COVID-19 pandemic demonstrated this clearly, as communication platforms became essential for maintaining relationships during mandatory physical separation. Families organized virtual celebrations, couples sustained long-distance relationships through video dates, and friends maintained social bonds through online gatherings. Furthermore, social media enables communities based on shared interests, creating support networks for people facing similar challenges. These examples illustrate that technology expands rather than diminishes our capacity for connection.

In conclusion, while excessive or mindless technology use can pose challenges, communication technology has predominantly strengthened social relationships by providing flexible tools for maintaining meaningful connections in our increasingly mobile and globalized society.
